translated: The conceptualization that conceptualizes the absence of marks is the same as the absence of marks.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dang mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med par rnam par rtog pas mnyam par shes te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dang mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med par rnam par rtog pas mnyam par shes te /
translated: One should know that conceptualization and the absence of marks are the same in terms of the absence of marks.

original: 'di shes shing shes pa la lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang med pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di shes shing shes pa la lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang med pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
translated: To know this and yet not have any pride in one’s knowledge is also a bodhisattva’s correct engagement.

original: gzhan yang smon pa med pa la rlom sems med par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: gzhan yang smon pa med pa la rlom sems med par yang sbyor la /
translated: “Moreover, when one engages in the absence of wishes without conceptualizing,

original: bsam bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor te /
analyzed: bsam bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor te /
translated: and yet engages in taking up birth intentionally,

original: de @393b smon lam 'debs kyang sems kyi bag la nyal bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: de @393b smon lam 'debs kyang sems kyi bag la nyal bar mi byed cing /
translated: Although they make aspirations, they do not do so with a latent tendency in the mind.

original: smon lam 'debs kyang smon lam gyis rgyu ba'ang med la /
analyzed: smon lam 'debs kyang smon lam gyis rgyu ba'ang med la /
translated: Although they make aspirations, they are not driven by their aspirations.

original: skye'ang skye zhing mtha' gnyis kar lta ba dang bral ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye'ang skye zhing mtha' gnyis kar lta ba dang bral ba 'di lta ste /
translated: They are born, but they are free from the view of the two extremes.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang bral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang bral bar gyur cing /
translated: They are free from the view of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine.”

original: skye'ang skye la 'chi 'pho dang skye pa dang yang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: skye'ang skye la 'chi 'pho dang skye pa dang yang bral ba yin te /
translated: They are born, but they are free from death, transmigration, and birth.

original: 'di shes shing shes pa la lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang med pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di shes shing shes pa la lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang med pa gang yin pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
translated: They know this and know it without having any excessive pride. This is also a bodhisattva’s correct application.

original: lha'i bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul ni gang shes rab kyi shes pas brtson pa'ang med la /
analyzed: lha'i bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul ni gang shes rab kyi shes pas brtson pa'ang med la /
translated: “Divine son, moreover, the bodhisattvas’ correct and perfect application is to be diligent with the knowledge of wisdom, but without being diligent.

original: thabs kyi shes pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par yang sbyor la /🔽thabs kyi shes pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par yang sbyor la / thabs kyi shes pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par yang sbyor la /
translated: The knowledge of means is applied to gather all virtuous qualities, and the knowledge of wisdom is applied to selflessness, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life, the absence of nourishment, and the absence of person.🔽The knowledge of means is applied to bring all sentient beings to full maturity, and the knowledge of wisdom is applied to the non-appropriation and non-rejection of all phenomena.

original: thabs kyi shes pas chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos kyi dbyangs dbyer med par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos kyi dbyangs dbyer med par yang sbyor la /
translated: The knowledge of means is applied to uphold all phenomena, and the knowledge of wisdom is applied to the indivisibility of all buddhas and the expanse of reality.

original: thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad la bla mar bya ba dang / gus par bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi @394a *//
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad la bla mar bya ba dang / gus par bya ba dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi @394a *//
translated: The knowledge of means is to apply oneself to venerating, respecting, making offerings to, and serving all the buddhas.

original: shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha'i zhing du'ang sbyor la /
analyzed: shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha'i zhing du'ang sbyor la /
translated: The knowledge of wisdom is to apply oneself to the fact that all buddhafields are the field of space.🔽The knowledge of means is to apply oneself to the adornment of the array of the qualities of the buddhafields.

original: thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyan la sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyan la sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar yang sbyor la /
translated: The knowledge of wisdom is to apply oneself to the fact that all the noble ones are distinguished by the unconditioned.🔽The knowledge of means is to apply oneself to venerating, respecting, and serving all the noble ones.

original: thabs kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad la bla ma dang / gus pa dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi sku zag pa med par so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad la bla ma dang / gus pa dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi sku zag pa med par so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
translated: The knowledge of wisdom is to apply oneself to the understanding that the body of the Buddha is uncontaminated.

original: thabs kyi shes pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / rgyan la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'du byed thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /🔽thabs kyi shes pas bsam bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / rgyan la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'du byed thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma byung bar so sor rtog par yang sbyor la / thabs kyi shes pas bsam bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par yang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of means they apply to the major and minor marks and to ornaments, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to the individual investigation of all compounded things as unborn and non-arisen.🔽With the knowledge of means they apply to the deliberate taking of birth in existence, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: thabs kyi shes pas lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / smon lam spang ba ston pa yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa skye ba med par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / smon lam spang ba ston pa yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa skye ba med par yang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of means they apply to the teaching of the abandonment of views, discursive thoughts and aspirations, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to the non-arising of the superknowledges.

original: thabs kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ma skyes pa dang mi gsog par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ma skyes pa dang mi gsog par yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply the knowledge of means to the display of all the superknowledges, and they apply the knowledge of wisdom to the non-arising and non-accumulation of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

original: thabs kyi shes pas phung po dang / khams @394b dang / skye mched yongs su 'dor bar yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas srid pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas phung po dang / khams @394b dang / skye mched yongs su 'dor bar yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas srid pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed par yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply the knowledge of means to the relinquishment of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres, and they apply the knowledge of wisdom to the realization that existence is the nature of nirvana.

original: thabs kyi shes pas 'khor ba na sems can yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas shes rab kyi mig la'ang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas 'khor ba na sems can yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas shes rab kyi mig la'ang sbyor la /
translated: They apply the knowledge of means to ripening sentient beings in samsara, and they apply the knowledge of wisdom to the eye of wisdom.

original: thabs kyi shes pas lha'i mig la mngon par sgrub pa la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos brjod du med par khong du chud par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas lha'i mig la mngon par sgrub pa la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos brjod du med par khong du chud par yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply the knowledge of means to the accomplishment of the divine eye, and they apply the knowledge of wisdom to the understanding of the inexpressibility of phenomena.

original: thabs kyi shes pas yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig gis chos ston par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas don dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa la yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig gis chos ston par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas don dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa la yang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of means they apply to teaching the Dharma with syllables and definitions, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to the perfect knowledge of the meaning and the Dharma.

original: thabs kyi shes pas nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sems can gyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa thams cad shes pa la'ang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la'ang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sems can gyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa thams cad shes pa la'ang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of means they apply to the perfect knowledge of definitions and confidence, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to knowing all the superior and non-superior faculties of sentient beings.

original: thabs kyi shes pas so so ci rigs par chos ston par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong khong du chud par byed par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas so so ci rigs par chos ston par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong khong du chud par byed par yang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of means they apply to teaching the Dharma in whatever way is appropriate for each individual, and with the knowledge of wisdom they apply to comprehending the eighty-four thousand kinds of sentient beings’ conduct.

original: thabs kyi shes pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong yang dag par ston par yang sbyor ba 'di ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul lo //🔽'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas sbyor ba yang dag pa 'di bstan pa na 'khor de las lha'i bu brgyad stong ni bla na @395a *//
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong yang dag par ston par yang sbyor ba 'di ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul lo // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas sbyor ba yang dag pa 'di bstan pa na 'khor de las lha'i bu brgyad stong ni bla na @395a *//
translated: With the wisdom of means, they also apply themselves to teaching the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma. This, divine prince, is the bodhisattvas’ correct and perfect application.

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: When Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta taught this correct application, eight thousand gods in the assembly gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: Five thousand bodhisattvas gave rise to the acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'jam dpal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'jam dpal /
translated: The Blessed One also said to Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta, “Mañjuśrī,

original: khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa 'di legs par bshad pa lags so //
analyzed: khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa 'di legs par bshad pa lags so //
translated: you have excellently explained this correct application of the bodhisattvas.

original: legs so // zhes bya ba byin no //
analyzed: legs so // zhes bya ba byin no //
translated: Excellent, excellent!”

original: de nas lha'i bu 'ong mang pos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽'jam dpal / khyod la de bzhin gshegs pas gang gi phyir legs so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu 'ong mang pos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so // 'jam dpal / khyod la de bzhin gshegs pas gang gi phyir legs so //
translated: Then many sons of gods said this to youthful Mañjuśrī:🔽Mañjuśrī, since the Tathāgata has given his approval to you, saying, “Excellent!”

original: zhes bya ba byin pas ci khyod dga' bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byin pas ci khyod dga' bar 'gyur ram /
translated: are you pleased?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽gang sprul pa'i sprul pa la legs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems / gang sprul pa'i sprul pa la legs so //
translated: Son of gods, what do you think?

original: zhes bya ba byin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byin na /
translated: If an emanation gives approval to an emanation,

original: sprul pa de la ci dga' bar 'gyur ba lta yod dam /
analyzed: sprul pa de la ci dga' bar 'gyur ba lta yod dam /
translated: does that emanation feel pleased?

original: lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / sprul pa la rjes su chags pa'ang med /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / sprul pa la rjes su chags pa'ang med /
translated: The son of gods said:

original: khong khro ba'ang med na /
analyzed: khong khro ba'ang med na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, since an emanation is neither attached nor averse,

original: de la dga' bar 'gyur ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la dga' bar 'gyur ba ci zhig yod /
translated: how could it feel pleased?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Son of gods, in the same way, all phenomena have the characteristic of being emanations by nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: The Tathāgata has that characteristic,

original: 'jam dpal yang de'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal yang de'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: and Mañjuśrī has that characteristic.

original: de la legs so //
analyzed: de la legs so //
translated: To that, “Excellent!”

original: zhes bya bas kho bo dga' bar 'gyur du ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhes bya bas kho bo dga' bar 'gyur du ci zhig yod /
translated: What pleasure could I have in that?

original: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / brag ca ni sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di lta ste / dper na / brag ca ni sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Divine son, it is like this:

original: khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, an echo is neither attached to pleasant sounds nor averse to unpleasant ones.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni brag ca'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin du chos thams cad ni brag ca'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Divine son, in the same way, all phenomena have the nature of an echo.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de'i rang bzhin /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has that nature,

original: @395b 'jam dpal yang de'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: @395b 'jam dpal yang de'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: and Mañjuśrī has that nature as well.

original: de la legs so zhes bya bas kho bo dga' bar 'gyur du ci yod /🔽lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: de la legs so zhes bya bas kho bo dga' bar 'gyur du ci yod / lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: What pleasure could I have in that?”

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas su la legs so zhes bya ba gnang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas su la legs so zhes bya ba gnang /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī, to whom did the Thus-Gone One give his approval?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: lha'i bu / rnam par shes pa mi gnas par ston pa dang / bstan pa thams cad la su'i blo thogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / su sems can thams cad la sems can du 'du shes mi 'jug pa dang / su chos thams cad la chos su 'du shes mi 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu / rnam par shes pa mi gnas par ston pa dang / bstan pa thams cad la su'i blo thogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / su sems can thams cad la sems can du 'du shes mi 'jug pa dang / su chos thams cad la chos su 'du shes mi 'jug pa dang /
translated: “Son of the gods, the Thus-Gone One has given his approval to bodhisattvas who teach that consciousness is non-abiding, who are not hindered by any teachings, who do not entertain the notion of sentient beings with regard to any sentient beings, who do not entertain the notion of phenomena with regard to any phenomena,

original: su bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang gnas la /🔽sbyor ba 'khor ba la'ang gnas pa dang / su bdud kyi las khong du chud nas bdud kyi las kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las su shes shing sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las la mngon par zhen na /
analyzed: su bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang gnas la / sbyor ba 'khor ba la'ang gnas pa dang / su bdud kyi las khong du chud nas bdud kyi las kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las su shes shing sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las la mngon par zhen na /
translated: who abide in the intention of nirvāṇa,

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las kyang bdud kyi las su shes pa de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las kyang bdud kyi las su shes pa de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la /
translated: who abide in the practice of saṃsāra, who understand the activities of Māra and know that the activities of Māra are the activities of the buddhas, and who, while not fixating on the activities of the buddhas, know that the activities of the buddhas are the activities of Māra.

original: lha'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngo //
translated: Son of the gods, the Thus-Gone One has given his approval to bodhisattvas who possess such qualities.”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The son of the gods said:🔽“Excellent!

original: 'jam dpal / ci de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pas khyod la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ci de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pas khyod la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngam /
translated: Mañjuśrī, is it because he possesses such qualities that the Tathāgata has given his approval?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Son of the gods, what do you think?

original: gang mnyam pa nyid de la mi mnyam pa gang yang yod dam /
analyzed: gang mnyam pa nyid de la mi mnyam pa gang yang yod dam /
translated: Is there anything that is not the same in that sameness?”

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: The son of the gods said:

original: 'jam dpal / mnyam pa nyid la mi mnyam pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mnyam pa nyid la mi mnyam pa gang yang med do //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there is nothing that is not the same in sameness.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu / mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang mtshams med pa mnyam mo //
analyzed: lha'i bu / mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang mtshams med pa mnyam mo //
translated: “Son of the gods, that which is the same as sameness is the same as the heinous actions.

original: mtshams med pa gang dang mnyam @396a *//
analyzed: mtshams med pa gang dang mnyam @396a *//
translated: That which is the same as the heinous actions

original: pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
analyzed: pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
translated: is the same as me.

original: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang lta bar gyur pa rnams mnyam mo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang lta bar gyur pa rnams mnyam mo //
translated: That which is the same as sameness is the same as the views.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
translated: That which is the same as the views is the same as me.

original: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang phyin ci log rnams mnyam mo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang phyin ci log rnams mnyam mo //
translated: That which is the same as sameness is the same as the errors.

original: phyin ci log rnams gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
translated: I am the same as the one who is the same as the errors.

original: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang dmigs pa mnyam mo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang dmigs pa mnyam mo //
translated: The same as the one who is the same as sameness.

original: dmigs pa gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang dang mnyam pa de dang kho bo mnyam mo //
translated: I am the same as the one who is the same as the objective support.

original: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'khor ba'i mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'khor ba'i mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The same as the one who is the same as the limit of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang bdag gi mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' mnyam mo // mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang bdag gi mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The same as the one who is the same as the limit of nirvāṇa.

original: bdag gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The same as the one who is the same as the limit of self.🔽The same as the one who is the same as the limit of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The same as the one who is the same as the limit of ignorance, craving, and desire.

original: ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of ignorance, of existence, and of craving is the same as the limit of knowledge and liberation.

original: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of knowledge and liberation is the same as the limit of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of desire, anger, and ignorance is the same as the limit of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dus byas kyi mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dus byas kyi mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the same as the limit of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of conditioned phenomena is the same as the limit of unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi @396b mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa mnyam ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi @396b mtha' gang dang mnyam pa de dang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa mnyam ste /
translated: The limit of the unconditioned is the same as the limit of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: lha'i bu / mnyam pa nyid des chos thams cad mnyam mo //
analyzed: lha'i bu / mnyam pa nyid des chos thams cad mnyam mo //
translated: Divine son, all phenomena are the same through this sameness.

original: de la su 'chad pa dang / gang bshad pa dang / gang la bshad pa dang / su la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa'i chos de dag thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam ste /🔽nam mkha' yang 'dus ma byas yin pas nam mkha' ni mnyam pa'ang med /
analyzed: de la su 'chad pa dang / gang bshad pa dang / gang la bshad pa dang / su la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa'i chos de dag thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam ste / nam mkha' yang 'dus ma byas yin pas nam mkha' ni mnyam pa'ang med /
translated: In this regard, the one who explains, that which is explained, that to whom it is explained, and that which is approved—all these phenomena are the same through being the same as space.

original: mi mnyam pa'ang med de /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'ang med de /
translated: Space is unconditioned, and so space is neither the same nor different.

original: su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid 'di dag gi rjes su song ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngo //
analyzed: su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid 'di dag gi rjes su song ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ngo //
translated: The Thus-Gone One approves of those who follow this sameness by not following anything.

original: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa; 'jam dpal /
translated: The god said, “Mañjuśrī,

original: khyod legs so //
analyzed: khyod legs so //
translated: you are excellent!

original: zhes bya ba dang / legs so zhes bya ba ma yin pa las brtsams te chos bstan pa la spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / legs so zhes bya ba ma yin pa las brtsams te chos bstan pa la spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Please explain the Dharma of what is excellent and not excellent.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu; lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu; lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: “Divine son, it is good to engage in awakening with a superior intention.

original: g-yo dang sgyus nye bar spyod pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyus nye bar spyod pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to engage in conduct that is deceitful and fraudulent.

original: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad mi gtong ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad mi gtong ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to never abandon any being out of great compassion.

original: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par 'tshe ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to harm any being.

original: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to have a mind that is never hostile toward any being.

original: gnod sems kyi bsam pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi bsam pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to have a malicious mind.

original: nyes pa byung ba mi 'chab cing 'chags te rnam par 'byed la kun nas bskor ba med par gnas pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba mi 'chab cing 'chags te rnam par 'byed la kun nas bskor ba med par gnas pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to not conceal one’s faults, to confess them, to reveal them, and to remain without concealment.

original: nyes pa byung ba 'chab pa ni legs pa ma @397a *//
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba 'chab pa ni legs pa ma @397a *//
translated: It is not good to conceal one’s faults.

original: yin pa'o // bdag gi 'khrul pa la so sor rtog pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: yin pa'o // bdag gi 'khrul pa la so sor rtog pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to examine one’s own mistakes.

original: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa'i skyon tshol ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa'i skyon tshol ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to look for the faults in others’ mistakes.

original: byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / byas pa chud mi gzon pa dang / byas pa la lan du phan 'dogs pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / byas pa chud mi gzon pa dang / byas pa la lan du phan 'dogs pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to be grateful and to know how to repay kindness. It is good to not waste what has been done. It is good to repay what has been done.

original: byas pa mi gzo ba dang / byas pa mi shes pa dang / byas pa chud gzon pa dang / byas pa lan du phan mi 'dogs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo ba dang / byas pa mi shes pa dang / byas pa chud gzon pa dang / byas pa lan du phan mi 'dogs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to not be grateful, to not know how to repay kindness, to waste what has been done, and to not repay what has been done.

original: thos pa yang dag par sgrub pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa yang dag par sgrub pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to practice what one has heard.

original: thos pa log par sgrub pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa log par sgrub pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to practice what one has heard wrongly.

original: bslab pa yang dag par blangs nas ma nyams pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa yang dag par blangs nas ma nyams pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to not transgress the precepts one has taken up.

original: bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa las 'da' ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa las 'da' ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to transgress the precepts one has taken up.

original: dben pa la sems gzhol zhing dben pa la dga' ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa la sems gzhol zhing dben pa la dga' ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to be inclined towards solitude and to delight in solitude.

original: 'du 'dzi la dga' ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la dga' ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to delight in busyness.

original: dgon pa la gnas par lus dang srog 'dor ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas par lus dang srog 'dor ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to give up one’s body and life for the sake of dwelling in the wilderness.

original: lus dang srog la lta ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog la lta ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to be concerned with one’s body and life.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs la yang dag par dga' ba dang / rung ba rnams la tshod rig pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs la yang dag par dga' ba dang / rung ba rnams la tshod rig pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to delight in the family of the noble ones.

original: chog mi shes shing 'dod pa che la sdig pa 'dod pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chog mi shes shing 'dod pa che la sdig pa 'dod pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to be insatiable, greedy, and desirous of sin.

original: nyam chung ba rnams la bzod cing dang du len pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: nyam chung ba rnams la bzod cing dang du len pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to be patient and tolerant with the weak.

original: sems can rnams la sma 'bebs pa ni @397b legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sma 'bebs pa ni @397b legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to despise sentient beings.

original: 'tsho ba dag pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dag pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to have a pure livelihood.

original: snyom las can ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: snyom las can ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to be lazy.

original: skyabs su sod pa rnams mi gtong ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su sod pa rnams mi gtong ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good not to abandon those who have taken refuge.

original: skyabs su song ba rnams la 'khu ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su song ba rnams la 'khu ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to harm those who have taken refuge.

original: dam bcas pa las mi nyams pa'i tshig bden pa dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa las mi nyams pa'i tshig bden pa dang / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to be truthful and to do what one says.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la bslu ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la bslu ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to deceive the whole world.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to uphold the true Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su spong ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su spong ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: To abandon the holy Dharma is not good.

original: thos pa la ser sna med cing chos la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud med de zang zing med par chos ston pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la ser sna med cing chos la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud med de zang zing med par chos ston pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: To teach the Dharma without holding back out of miserliness, and without holding back the Dharma out of teacher’s pride, and without seeking material reward, is good.

original: chos la ser sna byed cing chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed de zang zing dang 'brel ba'i sems kyis chos ston pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed cing chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed de zang zing dang 'brel ba'i sems kyis chos ston pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: To be miserly with the Dharma, to hold back the Dharma out of teacher’s pride, and to teach the Dharma with a mind attached to material reward, is not good.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i bsdu ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i bsdu ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: To gather disciples with the skillful means of ripening sentient beings is good.

original: sems can la mi lta zhing thabs dang mi ldan par bsdu ba'i dngos po ston pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la mi lta zhing thabs dang mi ldan par bsdu ba'i dngos po ston pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: To not care for sentient beings, and to teach the means of gathering disciples without skillful means, is not good.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug tshol ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug tshol ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: To seek the six perfections is good.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposing forces to the six perfections are not good.

original: shes pas byas pa'i las rnams ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pas byas pa'i las rnams ni legs pa'o //
translated: Actions done with knowledge are good.

original: nga rgyal gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis byas pa'i las rnams ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Actions done out of pride are not good.

original: mdza' ba brtan pa ni legs pa'o //🔽ngan pa dang @398a *//
analyzed: mdza' ba brtan pa ni legs pa'o // ngan pa dang @398a *//
translated: Firm friendship is good.

original: bshes pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bshes pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Bad friends are not good.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la brtan pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la brtan pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: Firmness in the path of the ten virtues is good.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du zhugs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //🔽sdig pa'i las thams cad mi spyod pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du zhugs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o // sdig pa'i las thams cad mi spyod pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: Engaging in the path of the ten nonvirtues is not good.🔽Not engaging in any sinful actions is good.

original: sdig pa'i las thams cad la zhugs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las thams cad la zhugs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Engaging in all sinful actions is not good.

original: lha'i bu / dmigs pa can gyi rab tu 'byung ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / dmigs pa can gyi rab tu 'byung ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Divine son, the going forth of those who have reference points is not good.

original: stong pa nyid smra ba'i mngon par 'byung ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba'i mngon par 'byung ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: The going forth of those who speak of emptiness is good.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gtam smra ba'i sengge'i khri ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gtam smra ba'i sengge'i khri ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The lion throne of those who speak the words of the Lokāyatas is not good.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rab tu thob pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi gtam smra ba'i sengge'i khri ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rab tu thob pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi gtam smra ba'i sengge'i khri ni legs pa'o //
translated: The lion throne of those who speak the Dharma of the Bodhisattvapitaka is good.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pas dad pas byin pa spyad pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pas dad pas byin pa spyad pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to use the offerings of the faithful when one has violated one's vow of morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to receive the offerings of the faithful when one is endowed with morality.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal can gyi byang chub ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal can gyi byang chub ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to be proud of one's enlightenment.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med par shes pa'i brda sprod pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med par shes pa'i brda sprod pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to be humble, thinking that one is only a teacher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod par sems pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod par sems pa ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to think of doing harm to the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa tsam du phangs par 'dzin pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa tsam du phangs par 'dzin pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to think of the bodhisattvas as one's teachers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis rnyed pas 'tsho ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis rnyed pas 'tsho ba ni legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not good to live off the name of bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems @398b dpa' chos smra ba yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i rnyed pa ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems @398b dpa' chos smra ba yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i rnyed pa ni legs pa'o //
translated: It is good to live off the offerings made to the bodhisattvas who are established in the practice of the Dharma.

original: lha'i bu / de ltar na ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang 'gal ba de tsam du thams cad legs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu / de ltar na ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang 'gal ba de tsam du thams cad legs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Devaputra, to the extent that one contradicts the word of the Tathagata, to that extent everything is not good.

original: ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang mthun pa de tsam du thams cad legs pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' dang mthun pa de tsam du thams cad legs pa'o //
translated: To the extent that one is in accord with the word of the Tathagata, to that extent everything is good.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /🔽'jam dpal / khyod ci legs so zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson nam /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa / 'jam dpal / khyod ci legs so zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson nam /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: 'on te legs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson /
analyzed: 'on te legs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson /
translated: Manjusri, are you striving for the Dharma of what is good, or are you striving for the Dharma of what is not good?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Manjusri replied:

original: lha'i bu / kho bo ni legs so zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i bu / kho bo ni legs so zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Devaputra, I am not striving for the Dharma of what is good,

original: legs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: legs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i chos la brtson pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor am I striving for the Dharma of what is not good.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu / kho bo ni chos thams cad la brtson pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu / kho bo ni chos thams cad la brtson pa ma yin no //
translated: Devaputra, I am not striving for any Dharma at all.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /

translated: To teach the vehicle of the hearers and the vehicle of the solitary buddhas but to conceal the teachings of the Great Vehicle is the work of Māra.

analyzed: zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing gtam sna tshogs ston pa'ang bdud kyi las so //

translated: “It is also a deed of Māra to abide in the yoga of vipaśyanā but not to cause beings to take up vipaśyanā.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus par zad par tshol zhing 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams la smon pa'ang bdud kyi las so //

analyzed: thabs dang mi ldan par dge ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdud kyi las so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mi tshol gyi /
